bibl.editor: Surgeon General Joseph K. Barnes, United States Army

wounds and injuries of the head
severer contusions of the head, resulting from falls
severe blow upon head by fall
terminated in such disabilities as to disqualify from further active service

additional proofing of transcription and encoding

initial checking of OCR text against PDF; encoded

body.p: CASE.—Private Dexter Cole, Co. I, 25th Michigan Volunteers, in October, 1862, received a severe blow upon the head by a fall, and was admitted into Stanton Hospital at Washington, on February 1st, 1863, completely deaf, in consequence of the commotion or concussion of the brain. Every method of treatment for the restoration of his hearing having been employed unavailingly, he was discharged from service February 26th, 1863, on the certificate of Surgeon John A. Lidell, of his total disability.
